metadata.description: Model validation against historical events - prediction vs actual error analysis
sources: Brown et al. (2013) - Chelyabinsk fireball analysis
Kring et al. (1996) - Barringer Meteor Crater studies
Collins et al. (2005) - Earth Impact Effects Program validation
metadata.critical_value: NOBODY does this. Showing 'our model was wrong here, here's why' = supreme confidence
metadata.jury_impact: GAME CHANGER - Shows scientific maturity: 'We know where we're uncertain'

model_validation_framework.description: Systematic comparison of model predictions vs historical reality
model_validation_framework.validation_philosophy: Good models aren't always right—they know when they're wrong

simple_crater_model.reason_for_error: Did not include atmospheric fragmentation physics

chyba_hills_model.reason_for_error: Good agreement, uncertainty in strength parameter

energy_estimate.lesson: Energy estimates reliable IF mass and velocity known

casualty_estimate.lesson: Casualty models validated for airburst events

early_comet_hypothesis.reason_for_error: Correct outcome, wrong reason (now think asteroid, not comet)

energy_estimate_range.lesson: Historical events have large parameter uncertainties

devastation_radius.reason_for_error: Forest channeling effect not fully modeled
devastation_radius.lesson: Terrain and vegetation affect damage radius

airburst_altitude.lesson: Airburst altitude sensitive to strength assumption

crater_size_pi_scaling.reason_for_error: Pi-scaling works well for simple craters
crater_size_pi_scaling.lesson: Crater scaling validated for iron impacts

total_mass.reason_for_error: Most mass vaporized or not recovered
total_mass.lesson: Recovered mass << total mass for explosive events

crater_diameter_pi_scaling.reason_for_error: Pi-group scaling excellent for well-constrained iron impact
crater_diameter_pi_scaling.lesson: Crater models highly accurate for known parameters

energy_estimate.lesson: Energy back-calculated from crater is reliable

survival_to_ground.reason_for_error: Stony meteorites RARELY make craters—Carancas was surprise
survival_to_ground.lesson: Small stony impacts less understood than thought

crater_size.reason_for_error: Underestimated strength OR water saturation in soil amplified crater
crater_size.lesson: Wet soil targets differ from dry soil models

model_accuracy_summary.overall_grade: C (model failed to predict ground impact)
model_accuracy_summary.note: This event showed gaps in small stony meteorite models

energy_estimate.main_uncertainty: Diameter and velocity (both cubed/squared in energy)

casualties.main_uncertainty: Population distribution, building quality, time of day

overconfidence_in_small_impacts.description: Models assume small asteroids fragment predictably—Carancas showed otherwise
overconfidence_in_small_impacts.correction: Add larger uncertainty bands for small stony asteroids
overconfidence_in_small_impacts.impact: Small impacts more unpredictable than models suggest

terrain_effects_underestimated.description: Tunguska showed forest channeling amplifies blast; urban canyons similar
terrain_effects_underestimated.impact: Damage radius can be 20-30% larger than free-field prediction

strength_parameter_uncertainty.description: Asteroid strength varies 100× (0.1 to 100 MPa), hard to constrain
strength_parameter_uncertainty.correction: Report range of altitudes for plausible strength range
strength_parameter_uncertainty.impact: Airburst altitude uncertain by factor of 2-3

casualty_model_oversimplification.description: Real casualties depend on building quality, time of day, response capacity
casualty_model_oversimplification.correction: Apply vulnerability multipliers (HDI, building codes, etc.)
casualty_model_oversimplification.impact: Same physics → 10× different casualties by location

high_confidence_predictions: Total impact energy (if mass and velocity known)
unknown_unknowns: Asteroid internal structure (coherent vs rubble pile)

recommendations_for_uncertainty_reportin.explain_main_uncertainties: Tell user what drives the uncertainty
recommendations_for_uncertainty_reportin.validate_against_history: Show how model performs on known events
recommendations_for_uncertainty_reportin.example_good_reporting: Predicted casualties: 10,000 (95% CI: 5,000-25,000). Main uncertainty: asteroid composition (could airburst at 20-40km altitude). Model validated against Chelyabinsk (6% error in altitude).

jury_demonstration_script.content: We tested our model on 5 historical events:

results.Carancas: 41% error (learned: small stony impacts are unpredictable)

jury_demonstration_script.message: Good models know when they're wrong. We report uncertainties, not false precision.
jury_demonstration_script.jury_impact: THIS IS CHAMPIONSHIP THINKING: 'We validated against history AND admit our limitations'
